summary: This is an email chain between federal prosecutors discussing and refining search terms to be applied to electronic devices seized in the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. The email includes an attachment of a draft search term list and references a search warrant.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Appears to be the author of the initial email attaching a draft list of search terms for electronic devices in the Epstein case.

events.title: Prosecutors Refine Search Terms for Epstein Devices
events.description: Federal prosecutors exchange emails to finalize a list of search terms to be run through electronic devices seized in the Epstein investigation, with the goal of sending the terms to an unspecified recipient over the weekend.

events.title: Search Warrant Issued
events.description: A search warrant (20 mag 6719) was issued, which is referenced as an attachment in the email chain.

keyFacts: Federal prosecutors were actively coordinating search terms for electronic devices seized in the Epstein investigation as of October 2020.
The search terms list was being refined to include words like 'massage', 'masseuse', and 'passenger', suggesting the focus of the search was on activities and roles associated with the allegations.
The email references a search warrant dated June 26, 2020 (20 mag 6719), indicating ongoing investigative activity after Epstein's death.
The correspondence indicates an intent to run the search terms through a document review platform (Relativity) on returns from search warrants ('SW returns').
